script.name: !lib.ai.ammo.supply.setup
script.description: Assign default values and missile types

line.comment: * This script forces the default values to be used by the AI ship's ammo and
* missile supply script.
* Everything is saved to a global array. The array is refreshed if
* - the script engine version (array index 0) changes
* - the version of the SUPPLY script (array index 1) changes.
* Indices 02 and 03 are unused. Modders may use them to leave their own flags to
* determine when the entire array needs to be reseeded with "their" values.
* They are cleared every time this array is recreated by this script.
* By overwriting the entire global array or altering data selectively, a modder
* can adapt the script to use new values, new missile types...
* $Supply.Player.Ships = [TRUE]
* Player ships regen ammo. So do ships attacking player ships.
* Debug feature. You don't normally want playerships spawning free stuff but
* it's easier to track things attacking YOU.
* $Supply.OOS.only = [TRUE]
* All ammo regen is suspended in the active sector.
* The limitation has been suggested. I don't believe that it's the best way but it
* was super easy to implement, so there.
* Script does supply missiles in addition to ammo.
* $Supply.Missiles.MB.only = [TRUE]
* Missile supply is limited to missile boats (M8,M7M).
* The chance that the ship can get supply of any listed, compatible missile.
* Civilian ships use a percent chance of the above values
* The MAX number to which missiles are refilled.
* Actual number will be RND (1/4 Amount) to (Amount).
* Civilian ships use a percent chance of the above values
* Missile supply does not run more often than that.
* When / after attacking player property, all supply is suspended X seconds.
* Flush old data just in case:
* Missile supply definitions are split into loadouts for
* normal ships and missile boats.
* MB REQUIRE noticably higher quantities to be useful in any way.
* v2: added config values for civilian jobs

sval.val: Assign default values and missile types
This script forces the default values to be used by the AI ship's ammo and
missile supply script.
Everything is saved to a global array. The array is refreshed if
- the script engine version (array index 0) changes
- the version of the SUPPLY script (array index 1) changes.
Indices 02 and 03 are unused. Modders may use them to leave their own flags to
determine when the entire array needs to be reseeded with "their" values.
They are cleared every time this array is recreated by this script.
By overwriting the entire global array or altering data selectively, a modder
can adapt the script to use new values, new missile types...
Player ships regen ammo. So do ships attacking player ships.
Debug feature. You don't normally want playerships spawning free stuff but
it's easier to track things attacking YOU.
All ammo regen is suspended in the active sector.
The limitation has been suggested. I don't believe that it's the best way but it
was super easy to implement, so there.
Script does supply missiles in addition to ammo.
Missile supply is limited to missile boats (M8,M7M).
The chance that the ship can get supply of any listed, compatible missile.
Civilian ships use a percent chance of the above values
The MAX number to which missiles are refilled.
Actual number will be RND (1/4 Amount) to (Amount).
Civilian ships use a percent chance of the above values
Missile supply does not run more often than that.
When / after attacking player property, all supply is suspended X seconds.
Flush old data just in case
Missile supply definitions are split into loadouts for
normal ships and missile boats.
MB REQUIRE noticably higher quantities to be useful in any way.
v2: added config values for civilian jobs
